member.summary: Does any actions involved in this wizard step when you move on to the next wizard step. E.g. Updates any Objects from User interface controls.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.WizardStepVWG.UndoMoveOn
member.summary: Undoes any actions that have been done by this wizard step. Usually you would want this to do nothing since if the user does a previous and then next they would not expect to lose their. But in some cases you may have created objects based on the selection in this step and when you move back to this step you want to these so that if the user changes his/her selection then new objects or different objects are created.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.WizardStepVWG.CancelStep
member.summary: Provides an interface for the developer to implement functionality to cancel all edits made as part of this wizard step. The default wizard controller functionality is to call all wizard steps cancelStep methods when its Cancel method is called on the Wizard Controller (i.e. typically when Cancel Button is selected.

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ReadOnlyGridControlVWG
member.summary:
Provides a combination of read-only grid, filter and buttons used to edit a collection of business objects.
Adding, editing and deleting objects is done by clicking the available buttons in the button control (accessed through the Buttons property). By default, this uses of a popup form for editing of the object, as defined in the "form" element of the class definitions for that object. You can override the editing controls using the BusinessObjectEditor/Creator/Deletor properties in this class.
A filter control is placed above the grid and is used to filter which rows are shown.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ReadOnlyGridControlVWG.SetBusinessObjectCollection(Habanero.Base.IBusinessObjectCollection)
member.summary: Sets the business object collection to display. Loading of the collection needs to be done before it is assigned to the grid. This method assumes a default UI definition is to be used, that is a 'ui' element without a 'name' attribute.
member.param: The business object collection to be shown in the grid

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ReadOnlyGridControlVWG.Initialise
member.summary: Initialises the grid without a ClassDef. This is used where the columns are set up manually. A typical case of when you would want to set the columns manually would be when the grid requires alternate columns, such as images to indicate the state of the object or buttons/links. The grid must already have at least one column added with the name "HABANERO_OBJECTID". This column is used to synchronise the grid with the business objects.
member.exception: Occurs where the columns have not already been defined for the grid

member.summary: Returns the that has been set for this .
member.returns: Returns the that has been set for this .

By default, this uses of a popup form for editing of the object, as defined in the "form" element of the class definitions for that object. You can override the editing controls using the BusinessObjectEditor/Creator/Deletor properties in this class.
A filter control is placed above the grid and is used to filter which rows are shown.

member.summary: Gets and Sets the business object collection displayed in the grid. This collection must be pre-loaded using the collection's Load() command or from the . The default UI definition will be used, that is a 'ui' element without a 'name' attribute.

members.member:
Represents a control to edit a collection of business objects. A grid lists the objects as specified by SetBusinessObjectCollection and a control below the grid allows the selected business object to be edited. Default buttons are provided: Save, New, Delete and Cancel.
The editing control is specified here as a IBusinessObjectControl, allowing the developer to pass in a custom control, but the default instantiation uses a IBusinessObjectPanel, which is more suited to displaying errors. If the developer provides a custom control, they are responsible for updating the business object status and displaying useful feedback to the user (by catching appropriate events on the business object or the controls).
Some customisation is provided through the GridWithPanelControlStrategy, including how controls should be enabled for the appropriate environment.
to the grid in the future. What happens when you double-click?

member.summary: Constructor for

member.summary: Constructor for

member.summary: Constructor for

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.GridWithPanelControlVWG`1.SetBusinessObjectCollection(Habanero.Base.IBusinessObjectCollection)
member.summary: Sets the business object collection to populate the grid. If the grid needs to be cleared, set an empty collection rather than setting to null. Until you set a collection, the controls are disabled, since any given collection needs to be provided by a suitable context.

The editing control is specified here as a IBusinessObjectControl, allowing the developer to pass in a custom control, but the default instantiation uses a IBusinessObjectPanel, which is more suited to displaying errors. If the developer provides a custom control, they are responsible for updating the business object status and displaying useful feedback to the user (by catching appropriate events on the business object or the controls).
Some customisation is provided through the GridWithPanelControlStrategy, including how controls should be enabled for the appropriate environment.

member.summary: Whether to show the save confirmation dialog when moving away from a dirty object

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.GridWithPanelControlStrategyVWG`1.CallApplyChangesToEditBusinessObject
member.summary: Indicates whether PanelInfo.ApplyChangesToBusinessObject needs to be called to copy control values to the business object. This will be the case if the application uses minimal events and does not update the BO every time a control value changes. This is typically the case with Web applications e.g. Visual Web Gui but could be used for Windows apps if required.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.GridWithPanelControlStrategyVWG`1.RefreshGrid
member.summary: Indicates whether the grid should be refreshed. For instance, a VWG implementation needs regular refreshes due to the lack of synchronisation. I.e. the model changes on the server are not pushed to the user interface in an individual browser. In a windows forms or other rich client application this is not necessary. In windows Refreshing the grid regularly will therefore actually deteriorate the application performance since changes to the business object model propogate themselves through the application.

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG
member.summary:
Provides a selection of common date range options which a user can select from, modifying a start date and end date depending on the selection. The options to choose from, such as "Yesterday", "Last Week" or "This Year", can be modified by the developer. When adding this control, add an event handler on the SelectionChangeCommitted event, and obtain the StartDate and EndDate properties at this time.
NOTE: The start and end dates are the two boundaries of a potential range. Whether they should be inclusive or exclusive depends on the developer and how they are implemented. For instance, if today is Nov 13, Yesterday would provide a start date of Nov 12, 12am and an end date of Nov 13, 12am.
To add additional menu options that aren't available, simply add the new text item to the ComboBox, using Items.Add. When you pick up the SelectionChangeCommitted event, check if the new text string is selected in the Text property and use your own calculations instead of fetching the StartDate and EndDate.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.Habanero#Faces#Base#IComboBox#get_DropDownWidth
member.summary:
Provides a selection of common date range options which a user can select from, modifying a start date and end date depending on the selection. The options to choose from, such as "Yesterday", "Last Week" or "This Year", can be modified by the developer. When adding this control, add an event handler on the SelectionChangeCommitted event, and obtain the StartDate and EndDate properties at this time.
NOTE: The start and end dates are the two boundaries of a potential range. Whether they should be inclusive or exclusive depends on the developer and how they are implemented. For instance, if today is Nov 13, Yesterday would provide a start date of Nov 12, 12am and an end date of Nov 13, 12am.
To add additional menu options that aren't available, simply add the new text item to the ComboBox, using Items.Add. When you pick up the SelectionChangeCommitted event, check if the new text string is selected in the Text property and use your own calculations instead of fetching the StartDate and EndDate.

The options to choose from, such as "Yesterday", "Last Week" or "This Year", can be modified by the developer. When adding this control, add an event handler on the SelectionChangeCommitted event, and obtain the StartDate and EndDate properties at this time.
NOTE: The start and end dates are the two boundaries of a potential range. Whether they should be inclusive or exclusive depends on the developer and how they are implemented. For instance, if today is Nov 13, Yesterday would provide a start date of Nov 12, 12am and an end date of Nov 13, 12am.
To add additional menu options that aren't available, simply add the new text item to the ComboBox, using Items.Add. When you pick up the SelectionChangeCommitted event, check if the new text string is selected in the Text property and use your own calculations instead of fetching the StartDate and EndDate.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.UseFixedNowDate
member.summary: Gets and sets whether the date used to calculate date ranges should be DateTime.Now or a fixed date that is specified. When false, all date ranges are calculated based on DateTime.Now. Setting this property to true allows you to use an alternative fixed date as your "Now" value, using the FixedNow property.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.FixedNowDate
member.summary: Gets and sets a fixed date used to calculate date ranges, rather than DateTime.Now. The UseFixedNowDate property must be set to true, otherwise this property will be ignored.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.OptionsToDisplay
member.summary: Gets and sets the list of options to display. If you intend to edit individual items in the list, either set the entire list once you have edited it, or use the Add and Remove methods provided by this class, otherwise the ComboBox list will not be refreshed.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.IgnoreTime
member.summary: Sets the current date (eg. DateTime.Now or FixedNowDate) in all calculations to 12am. Use caution when using this together with a MidnightOffset, in which case you may rather want to manually edit the time just before calling StartDate and EditDate (use UseFixedNowDate and FixedNowDate).

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.MidnightOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the amount of time to add or subtract from midnight when calculating date ranges. This option will typically be used where a shift operates on a different pattern to 12am to 12am (the default). If, for instance, an industry's operational day runs from 6am to 6am, this property can be set with a TimeSpan that adds 6 hours. Conversely, if the day starts 2 hours earlier, at 10pm the previous evening, set the property with a TimeSpan that subtracts 2 hours.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.WeekStartOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of days to add or subtract from Monday to redefine the first day of the week. If Sunday is the first day of the week for the given application, then this property can be set with -1. If Tuesday is the first day then use 1 (1+1=2).

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.MonthStartOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of days to add or subtract from the first day of the month in order to adjust which day is typically the first of the month. If the 5th is the typical start of a new month for the given application, then this property can be set to 4 (1+4=5).

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.YearStartOffset
member.summary: Gets and sets the number of months to add or subtract from January to redefine the first month of the year. For example, if March is the first month of the new year for the given application, then this property can be set with 2 (1+2=3).

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.StartDate
member.summary: Returns the start date for the currently selected date range option, or DateTime.MinValue if no valid option is selected

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.DateRangeComboBoxVWG.EndDate
member.summary: Returns the end date for the currently selected date range option, or DateTime.MaxValue if no valid option is selected

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ComboBoxAutoCompleteSourceVWG.GetAutoCompleteSource(Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms.AutoCompleteSource)
member.summary: Gets the Habanero AutoCompleteSource equivalent to the provided Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms AutoCompleteSource
member.param: A Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms AutoCompleteSource.
member.returns: The equivalent Habanero AutoCompleteSource.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ComboBoxAutoCompleteSourceVWG.GetAutoCompleteSource(Habanero.Faces.Base.AutoCompleteSource)
member.summary: Gets the Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms AutoCompleteSource equivalent to the provided Habanero AutoCompleteSource
member.param: A Habanero AutoCompleteSource.
member.returns: The equivalent Gizmox.WebGUI.Forms AutoCompleteSource.

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.MultiSelectorVWG`1
member.summary: Provides a multiselector control. The type to be displayed in the lists is set by the template type. The multiselector helps the user to select from an available list of options. Unselected options appear on the left and selected ones appear on the right. The AvailableOptions consists of all options, both selected and unselected - no object may appear in the selected list if it is not also in the AvailableOptions list. All list control is managed through the Model object.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.GridBaseVWG.GridLoader
member.summary:
Gets and sets the delegated grid loader for the grid.
This allows the user to implememt a custom loading strategy. This can be used to load a collection of business objects into a grid with images or buttons that implement custom code. (Grids loaded with a custom delegate generally cannot be set up to filter (grid filters a dataview based on filter criteria), but can be set up to search (a business object collection loaded with criteria). For a grid to be filterable the grid must load with a dataview.
If no grid loader is specified then the default grid loader is employed. This consists of parsing the collection into a dataview and setting this as the datasource.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.ComboBoxSelectorVWG.PreserveSelectedItem
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the current SelectedBusinessObject should be preserved in the selector when the BusinessObjectCollection is changed to a new collection which contains the current SelectedBusinessObject. If the SelectedBusinessObject doesn't exist in the new collection then the SelectedBusinessObject is set to null. If the current SelectedBusinessObject is null then this will also be preserved. This overrides the AutoSelectFirstItem property.

member.summary: Creates a control mapper strategy for the management of how business object properties and their related controls update each other. member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG
member.summary:
Provides a grid on which the user can edit data and add new business objects directly.
IMPORTANT: This grid does not provide any buttons or menus for users to save the changes they have made, and all changes will be lost if the form is closed and changes are not saved programmatically. Either carry out a dirty check when the parent form is closed and take appropriate save action using SaveChanges(), or use an IEditableGridControl, which provides Save and Cancel buttons.
member.remarks: The support for some tailored features done in the Win versions is not available here, including customised delete key behaviour and combobox clicking. Potentially, the option of confirming deletion before deleting a row could be implemented in the future.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.#ctor
member.summary: parameterless constructor

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.CreateDataSetProvider(Habanero.Base.IBusinessObjectCollection)
member.summary: Creates the appropriate dataSetProvider depending on the grid type e.g. editable grid should return a and a readonly grid should return a
member.param: The column that the dataset provider is being created for
member.returns: The created dataset provider

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.RejectChanges
member.summary: Restore the objects in the grid to their last saved state

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.SaveChanges
member.summary: Saves the changes made to the data in the grid

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.CheckUserWantsToDelete
member.summary: Displays a message box to the user to check if they want to proceed with deleting the selected rows.
member.returns: Returns true if the user does want to delete

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.DeleteKeyHandler
member.summary: Carries out actions when the delete key on the keyboard is pressed. This has been made public purely for testing purposes.

Provides a grid on which the user can edit data and add new business objects directly.
IMPORTANT: This grid does not provide any buttons or menus for users to save the changes they have made, and all changes will be lost if the form is closed and changes are not saved programmatically. Either carry out a dirty check when the parent form is closed and take appropriate save action using SaveChanges(), or use an IEditableGridControl, which provides Save and Cancel buttons.
member.remarks: The support for some tailored features done in the Win versions is not available here, including customised delete key behaviour and combobox clicking. Potentially, the option of confirming deletion before deleting a row could be implemented in the future.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.DeleteKeyBehaviour
member.summary: Indicates what action should be taken when a selection of cells is selected and the Delete key is pressed. This has no correlation to how DataGridView handles the Delete key when the full row has been selected.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.EditableGridVWG.ComboBoxClickOnce
member.summary: Gets or sets whether clicking on a ComboBox cell causes the drop-down to appear immediately. Set this to false if the user should click twice (first to select, then to edit), which is the default behaviour.

member.param: The control factory that this control will use to create a button

member.summary: Attempts to go to the next step in the wizard. If this is disallowed by the wizard controller a MessagePosted event will be fired.

member.summary: Attempts to go to the previous step in the wizard.

This control shows each business object in its own collapsible Panel. This is a very powerfull control for easily adding or viewing a fiew items E.g. for a list of addresses for a person.

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.BOColTabControlVWG
member.summary:
Displays a business object collection in a tab control, with one business object per tab. Each tab holds a business control, provided by the developer, that refreshes to display the business object for the current tab.
This control is suitable for a business object collection with a limited number of objects.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.BOColTabControlVWG.#ctor(Habanero.Faces.Base.IControlFactory)
member.summary: Constructor to initialise a new tab control

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.BOColTabControlVWG.GetBo(Habanero.Faces.Base.ITabPage)
member.summary: Returns the business object represented in the specified tab page
member.param: The tab page
member.returns: Returns the business object, or null if not available

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.BOColTabControlVWG.GetTabPage(Habanero.Base.IBusinessObject)
member.summary: Returns the TabPage object that is representing the given business object
member.param: The business object being represented
member.returns: Returns the TabPage object, or null if not found

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.BOColTabControlVWG.Clear
member.summary: Clears the business object collection and the rows in the data table

member.summary: Returns the business object at the specified row number
member.param: The row number in question
member.returns: Returns the busines object at that row, or null if none is found

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG
member.summary:
Provides a template for a standard Habanero application, including standard fields and initialisations. Specific details covered are:
The class definitions that define how the data is represented and limited
The database configuration, connection and settings
A logger to record debugging and error messages
An exception notifier to communicate exceptions to the user
Automatic version upgrades when an application is out-of-date
A synchronisation controller
A control factory to create controls
A data accessor that specifies what type of data source is used (DB by default)
To set up and launch an application:
Instantiate the application with the constructor
Specify any individual settings as required
Call the Startup() method to launch the application

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Constructor to initialise a new application with basic application information. Use the Startup() method to launch the application.
member.param: The application name
The application version

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.SetupControlFactory
member.summary: Sets the control factory used to create controls

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.SetupSettings
member.summary: Initialises the settings. If not provided, DatabaseSettings is assumed.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.SetupDatabaseConnection
member.summary: Sets up the database connection. If not provided, then reads the connection from the config file.

member.name: M:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.SetupExceptionNotifier
member.summary: Sets up the exception notifier used to display exceptions to the final user. If not specified, assumes the FormExceptionNotifier.

member.name: P:Habanero.Faces.VWG.HabaneroAppVWG.DatabaseConfig
member.summary: Sets the database configuration object, which contains basic connection information along with the database vendor name (eg. MySql, Oracle).

member.name: T:Habanero.Faces.VWG.StaticDataEditorVWG
member.summary:
Provides an editor for static data in an application. Static data serves a number purposes including providing source data for lookup lists used in drop-downs.
The editor typically consists of a TreeView on the left and an EditableGrid on the right, where data for the selected type in the TreeView can be edited.

member.summary: Adds a section to the treeview, under which individual items can be listed
member.param: The name of the section as it appears to the user

member.summary: Adds an item to the treeview
member.param: The name of the item as it appears to the user
The class definition holding a grid def used to construct the grid for that type

member.summary: Selects an item with the given name in the treeview

member.summary: Rejects (restores) changes to the grid since the last save
